description: Patient with unexpected ICU admission due to uncontrolled pain post-surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Patient was admitted for scoliosis surgery. Post-operative day one, the patient reported pain out of proportion to injury, requiring increased analgesic management. Due to persistent severe pain and inability to manage discomfort, the patient was transferred unexpectedly to the ICU for closer monitoring.

items.signal_id: Pain out of proportion to injury
items.substring: pain out of proportion to injury
increased analgesic management
transferred unexpectedly to the ICU

description: Patient readmitted due to surgical site infection after discharge.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: The patient presented with fever and erythema at the surgical site five days post-discharge. Upon examination, there was notable wound drainage and increased back pain. A surgical site infection was diagnosed, necessitating readmission for IV antibiotics and further evaluation.

items.substring: notable wound drainage and increased back pain
A surgical site infection was diagnosed
necessitating readmission for IV antibiotics

description: Patient returned to OR for hardware complication after initial scoliosis surgery.

notes.text: The patient was discharged post-surgery but returned with severe pain and inability to ambulate. Imaging revealed loss of reduction of spinal hardware, necessitating a return to the operating room for correction.

returned with severe pain and inability to ambulate

description: Patient readmitted due to pneumonia after scoliosis surgery.

items.substring: developed cough and difficulty breathing

description: Patient readmitted due to surgical site infection after scoliosis surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Patient was admitted for scoliosis surgery on 12/30/2024. On POD 5, the patient presented with increased drainage and erythema around the incision site. Antibiotics were initiated, and the patient was monitored closely. The surgical team was consulted, and a return to the OR was planned to address the suspected infection.

items.substring: increased drainage and erythema around the incision site
suspected infection

description: Patient readmitted due to uncontrolled pain and hardware complication post-surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Following scoliosis correction on 12/28/2024, the patient was discharged after 3 days. However, by POD 6, the patient returned with complaints of severe back pain and difficulty walking. Imaging revealed a potential hardware issue that necessitated an urgent return to the operating room for revision.

items.substring: severe back pain and difficulty walking
potential hardware issue

description: Patient readmitted due to GI complications post-scoliosis surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: The patient was discharged after successful scoliosis surgery on 12/29/2024. However, on POD 4, they presented with abdominal pain and inability to tolerate oral intake. Evaluation indicated an ileus, necessitating readmission and further management.

items.substring: abdominal pain and inability to tolerate oral intake

notes.text: Patient underwent scoliosis surgery on 12/31/2024 and was initially stable. On POD 3, the patient developed respiratory distress requiring transfer to the ICU for further monitoring and management.

description: Unplanned admission due to uncontrolled pain after AIS surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Patient, a 16-year-old female with idiopathic scoliosis, presented to the ED on POD 5 after discharge with complaints of uncontrolled pain despite high doses of analgesics. The pain was out of proportion to the expected post-operative recovery process, leading to her admission for further management.

items.substring: uncontrolled pain despite high doses of analgesics
presented to the ED on POD 5 after discharge

description: Unplanned admission due to GI complication after AIS surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Patient, a 14-year-old male, was discharged on POD 2 following correction of idiopathic scoliosis. On POD 6, he presented with abdominal distension and vomiting. Imaging confirmed an ileus, leading to an unplanned admission for bowel management.

items.substring: presented with abdominal distension and vomiting
presented with abdominal distension

description: Unplanned return to OR due to infection after AIS surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Patient, a 15-year-old female diagnosed with idiopathic scoliosis, was readmitted on POD 7 with fever and purulent drainage from the surgical site. Cultures confirmed a surgical site infection, necessitating a return to the OR for irrigation and debridement.

items.substring: purulent drainage from the surgical site
readmitted on POD 7 with fever
return to the OR for irrigation and debridement

notes.text: Patient reports pain level of 8/10 and requires increasing doses of analgesics.

notes.text: Patient states pain is manageable at 4/10 with current medication regimen.

moderate serous drainage from the wound site

The patient was managed conservatively and admitted for observation.

description: Patient with unrelated complications leading to an unplanned admission after scoliosis surgery.
